In July 2014, Samson announced on Twitter that a new Pink Floyd album titled The
Endless River would be released in November. Former backing vocalist Durga
McBroom said that the music came from a side project called "The Big Spliff",
recorded at the Division Bell sessions, and added that Gilmour and Mason had done
more recent work. The music features Wright, but Waters is not involved

Gilmour described the record as follows: Ã¢â‚¬Å“The Endless River has as its starting
point the music that came from the 1993 Division Bell sessions. We listened to
over 20 hours of the three of us playing together and selected the music we
wanted to work on for the new album. Over the last year weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve added new parts,
re-recorded others and generally harnessed studio technology to make a 21st
century Pink Floyd album. With Rick gone, and with him the chance of ever
doing it again, it feels right that these revisited and reworked tracks should
be made available as part of our repertoire.Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½

Gilmour stated that The Endless River will be Pink Floyd's last album, saying:
"I think we have successfully commandeered the best of what there is ...
It's a shame, but this is the end.
